intro: Hibbertia superans, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with prominent stamens. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough, hairy texture. Hibbertia superans plays an important role in the ecosystem, providing nectar for native pollinators.
